data: If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps forward. Take 9 steps right. Take 10 steps backward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

Pointing forward makes you head backwards. The instructions say that on one side of a square is 3 steps ahead. If you are facing forward with your head facing forward, you are 9 steps left and forward with your nose upwards. If you are facing left with your head towards your feet and your feet are side by side, you are 9 steps right and backward with your nose upwards. So, the answer is no.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
You could turn around and turn right. It would be impossible to turn right and turn around at the same time. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 6 steps. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 10 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Once you turn around, you only need to take 4 steps to get back to the beginning point. So, the answer is yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 7 steps. Take 1 step. Take 7 steps. Turn left. Take 5 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
In order to take 7 steps you take a step one last time. The goal you got is 5 steps when you return to the starting point. So, the answer is yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 10 steps. Turn left. Turn left. Take 9 steps. Take 3 steps. Take 3 steps. Turn around. Take 5 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

You start from a place where you turned left and you take 10 steps to go to the place where you turned left and you take 9 steps to go to the place where you turned left then you take 3 steps to go to the place where you turned right and then 3 steps to go to the place where you turns left and then go back to the place where you turned right then you take 9 steps to go to the place where you turned left and then after your turn you take 5 steps to go to the place where you turned left then you take 3 steps to go to the place where you turned right and then you take 3 steps to go to the place where you turns right then you take 5 steps to go to the place where you turned left and after your turn you turn around and take 5 steps to go to the place where you turned right then you take 5 steps to go to the place where you turned right then you take 5 steps to go to the place where you turned left and after take 5 steps to go to the place where you turned right then there must be the correct way from left to right then you take 5 steps to go to the place where you turned right then you take 5 steps to go to the place where you turned right and after take 5

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Turn left. Turn right. Take 7 steps. Turn around. Take 7 steps. Turn right. Turn left. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Turnright and left are two different directions. If you turn left and turn right, you return to the starting point. So, the answer is no.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 8 steps. Take 9 steps. Turn right. Turn right. Take 8 steps. Take 9 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
To return to the starting point you have to turn right at the last word in the passage. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 6 steps. Turn around. Take 8 steps. Take 2 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
You start at 6 Steps to the Right. You take 2 steps back to start at 6 Steps. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 1 step left. Take 4 steps forward. Take 6 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
If you always face forward, you will finish all the steps you took up until the point that you started. So, the answer is no.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 3 steps. Take 9 steps. Turn around. Take 2 steps. Take 7 steps. Take 3 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
You can only take seven steps at a time, so there are only 3 steps back to the starting point. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 1 step backward. Take 1 step backward. Take 1 step backward. Take 3 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Always face forward. Take 1 step backward. Take 1 step backward. Take 3 steps forward. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 6 steps backward. Take 8 steps right. Take 1 step backward. Take 5 steps left. Take 2 steps left. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
A step backward takes you to the starting point. A step backward includes a number, one, two, three, four, five, two. So, the answer is no.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps left. Take 3 steps left. Take 1 step left. Take 3 steps backward. Take 6 steps left. Take 3 steps forward. Take 4 steps right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
You can return to the starting point by facing the direction you started from. The step left is always the same direction as taken. So, the answer is no.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 4 steps left. Take 3 steps forward. Take 1 step right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
If you never face forward or take 4 steps left and 3 steps forward, you will always return to the starting point. So, the answer is no.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 3 steps right. Take 1 step backward. Take 6 steps left. Take 1 step forward. Take 3 steps right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

This is an obvious example of a pattern. When you take 1 step forward, the direction of your step goes right, and when you take the other 5 steps you must return to your starting place. Thus, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Turn right. Turn right. Turn around. Turn left. Take 4 steps. Take 10 steps. Take 8 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Turning left does not mean you turn around. It means you take 4 steps or 20 steps whichever is shorter. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 10 steps. Turn around. Take 9 steps. Take 10 steps. Turn around. Take 3 steps. Take 6 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Take 9 steps to go back to the starting point. Take 10 steps then turn around and take 3 steps. Take 6 steps, take 6 steps, and turn around and take 9 steps. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 7 steps. Take 9 steps. Turn around. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
The first step is one step back. The next step is walking around until you get to where you started. The third step is walking straight to the right. So, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Turn around. Take 1 step. Take 2 steps. Take 9 steps. Take 7 steps. Turn left. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
If you go in the direction of the starting point and back around — that is, go right inwards and take 7 steps to the starting point. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Turn right. Take 1 step. Take 7 steps. Take 1 step. Take 5 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
You can’t take a step back 1 step and a step back 5 steps. Thus, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 1 step. Take 1 step. Take 3 steps. Turn left. Take 6 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

If one takes 1 step first, taking 1 step is the first thing you should do. You would not take 3 steps if one took the first step first. You would not be able to make the starting point back to first step. So, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 5 steps. Take 3 steps. Take 2 steps. Turn around. Take 10 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
If you take 10 steps, you have to take ten steps back. So, the answer is No.

The first method should return you to the starting point. The second method should return you to the starting point. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 7 steps left. Take 2 steps right. Take 5 steps backward. Take 8 steps left. Take 7 steps forward. Take 7 steps right. Take 9 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
There are 7 steps left when you go 5 steps forward. This is because you are facing forward. There are 2 steps right whenever you go 5 steps backward. So, the answer is no.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 7 steps backward. Take 9 steps left. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

If someone faces forward, you will always face forward. If someone faces backward, you will always face backward. If someone faces left, you will always face left. Taking 7 steps backward takes you to the starting point. The starting point is typically the first thing you see when you walk to the point you start. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Turn around. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 4 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
The starting point is the point that you want to turn around in. So, the answer is yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 6 steps left. Take 6 steps right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

Since face forward is always facing forward, the direction changes as you move forward from left to right. Changing a direction to the right and back is the same as moving left to right. So, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Turn right. Take 5 steps. Turn around. Take 5 steps. Turn around. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
A right turn can lead to the starting point. It is always better to turn around rather than just to turn right. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 2 steps backward. Take 3 steps backward. Take 3 steps backward. Take 8 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Forward facing is the proper mental position to all four directions, but the first two steps forward represent forward steps. So, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 3 steps. Take 10 steps. Take 4 steps. Take 1 step. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

You take 3 steps in a square, and a square has one step which equals the amount of times you can take one. And the numbers that you ommit during the time you are omitting steps = one omment, one re-movement and one return. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 9 steps. Turn around. Take 9 steps. Turn around. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
The first step to turn around is to start zig-zagging. There is a 9 way signal. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 10 steps right. Take 7 steps backward. Take 3 steps left. Take 8 steps backward. Take 3 steps backward. Take 8 steps right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Take three steps left and you are back in the original starting square. Take 10 steps right and you are back in the original starting square. So, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 7 steps. Turn around. Turn around. Turn around. Take 1 step. Take 6 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Turn around, take 1 step, take 6 steps are the same way to turn around. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 5 steps backward. Take 4 steps backward. Take 9 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
The original position is facing forward. The fourth step is 4 steps backwards. They are different steps from the first step. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 5 steps left. Take 1 step backward. Take 4 steps right. Take 1 step backward. Take 8 steps left. Take 6 steps left. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
To turn, facing forward for 5 steps, then take 4 steps right, then take 1 step backward, and finally take 8 steps to move left. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 3 steps forward. Take 3 steps backward. Take 3 steps backward. Take 7 steps left. Take 7 steps right. Take 8 steps backward. Take 4 steps backward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

It takes 3 steps backward; 3 steps forward; 3 steps backward can be combined to form the following list of steps. The set of steps are also reversed: A = 5 steps backward; B = 3 steps forward; C = 4 steps backward. An is reversed: C = 3 steps forward. If B = 5 steps backward, an is reversed: B = 8 steps backward, an is reversed: C = 4 steps backward These steps are reversed: C = 3 steps backward. If A = 5 steps backward, an is reversed: B = 3 steps forward. If C = 2 steps backward, an is reversed: C = 1 step backward. If A = 3 steps forward, an is reversed: B = 4 steps backward.

A person returns to the starting point after taking 10 steps. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 6 steps forward. Take 4 steps forward. Take 9 steps backward. Take 1 step backward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

Take a step up and face forward on the way forward. Take a 4 and take at least 4 steps. Take 9 and move to the starting point, face forward, then take 1 step backward on the way back to the starting point. So, the answer is no.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 5 steps. Take 5 steps. Take 7 steps. Take 10 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
The first step is the one involving moving forward. The second step is the one involving returning to the starting point. So, the answer is Yes.

Steps 1 to 6 are the same thing, although you can take different steps. If the starting point is the starting place, then there is a distinct first step. In the instructions, if you are facing forward, you always face forward, and the starting point is to the right. So, the answer is no.

If you are facing forward you always take a forward step. Take 2 steps backward. Take 4 steps backward. Take 6 steps forward. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 10 steps. Turn around. Turn right. Turn left. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
One takes 10 steps to turn around. One turns around. So, the answer is yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 7 steps left. Take 8 steps right. Take 10 steps backward. Take 4 steps left. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
The easiest way to return to the starting point is to take 4 steps left of where you are going. The answer: No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 5 steps right. Take 4 steps backward. Take 8 steps left. Take 5 steps left. Take 6 steps backward. Take 9 steps forward. Take 5 steps right. Take 1 step forward. Take 3 steps right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

In order to return to your starting point, you first need to take 9 steps forward. The first step is the easiest as you are able to take all of the first sequence of steps while facing forward. In order to perform an incorrect sequence of steps, you need to take different sequences of steps. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 6 steps right. Take 1 step forward. Take 4 steps right. Take 4 steps left. Take 8 steps left. Take 2 steps forward. Take 9 steps forward. Take 3 steps left. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Taking 3 steps left is taking 9 steps forward. The starting point is facing forward. The starting point is facing the middle of the room. So, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Turn left. Take 9 steps. Take 3 steps. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

The first 6 steps you take back to start. You can only take 6 steps at a time. Turning left is the opposite of turning right. In a straight line, your first 9 steps take you right. So, the answer is yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 6 steps right. Take 9 steps left. Take 5 steps left. Take 8 steps right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

Take 9 steps left. Do 1/10th of the left or 1/2 the right. Take 3/10ths of the right or 3/10ths of the right. To start from the starting point you’d take 6 steps, 2nd from the right, 5 steps left, then 8 steps right. If you stepped in reverse and returned to the starting point, you’d take 6 + 4, 4th from the right, 5 + 8, and then 8 - 4th from the left. It’s the same method as when you took a left turn, but instead of stepping into the starting point, you started right. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 4 steps left. Take 5 steps backward. Take 2 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
The phrase "take two steps forward" here refers to facing forward. For this passage, the starting point is facing forward. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 10 steps backward. Take 8 steps backward. Take 10 steps forward. Take 7 steps backward. Take 1 step forward. Take 7 steps right. Take 1 step left. Take 1 step right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

First step forward is the forward motion. If you take 8 steps backward you take 8 steps backward. If you take 7 steps backward you take 7 steps backward. The correct order is right then forward then left then right. So, the answer is yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 7 steps backward. Take 10 steps right. Take 4 steps forward. Take 1 step left. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

If you always face forward, in a forward direction, you'll always move forward and backward. You don't take 10 steps right, which is towards the middle of your position. You should always move left and right toward where you want to be. If you always face left, facing you right to right, you'll always move left and right towards where you want to be. So, the answer is No.
